page.title: 11Health. Hospitals
page.content: The two hospitals are Mount Pleasant, built in 1919, and St. Lawrence built in 1938.St. Lawrence was built originally as a military hospital and Mount Pleasant for ship yard workers. St. Lawrence covers 17 acres and has 139 patients,mainly from South Wales. It includes a famous burns unit and a hospital school for in-patients and some handicapped children. Mount Pleasant covers 19 acres with 184 patients.It has a Geriatric,G.P. and a Casualty Unit.There are 720 staff most of whom live in Chepstow.80 operations are preformed every week.The Hospitals cost Â£5\ million a year to run.The worst emergency they have ever had to cope with was when 10 people were admitted to the Burns Unit.The Health Centre covers 3 practices,has 10 doctors who practice Child Health, Chiropody and dental work.
